title: Teacher Program: Exhibition Snapshot—Medieval and Renaissance Art, Arms, and Armor
hero_caption: <p>Italian, Milan. Three-Quarter Armor for Field and Tournament, 1570/80. George F. Harding Collection.</p>
description:
This March, we unveil a major reinstallation of our galleries of art of the Middle Ages and Renaissance that will feature our beloved arms and armor collection and beautiful examples of painting, metalwork, ceramics, and textile arts. The reinstallation has enabled conservation work on many pieces and the addition of several thousand square feet of gallery space. This workshop will feature an interactive gallery experience, resources, and ideas for incorporating this content into different areas of the curriculum.

Exhibition Snapshot is a program format that features guest artists, curators, and educators discussing special exhibitions. This workshop is open to teachers of all grades and disciplines.

Registration is required for this program.

For additional teacher workshops, please visit the Teacher Programs calendar.

If you have any questions or special needs, please call (312) 443-3719 or e-mail ERC@artic.edu.
